Hey team, *<@U02373D477H>* needs support! :goodchop_fan:Please check the details.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------

*Priority:* Low :large_green_circle: 
*Topic:* E2E Test / Unit Test


:mag: *Issue reported:*
Hi team, there is a failing e2e test blocking my PR
test: checkoutWithTrialBoxWithCutsSelection.spec.ts
PR: <https://github.com/hellofresh/web/pull/57995>
Thank you!


:footprints: *Steps to reproduce:*
Run the checkoutWithTrialBoxWithCutsSelection.spec.ts test on master

elements.text:
Hi team, there is a failing e2e test blocking my PR
test:

Seems like it’s resolved today. Could you please give it a final try on the rerun and let us know?

messages.text:
Hey team, *<@U01B2LBUPND>* needs support! :goodchop_fan:Please check the details.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------

*Priority:* Medium :large_yellow_circle:
*Topic:* CCM / Menu / AddOns / Menu Replacement


:mag: *Issue reported:*
Hi there team can you please substitute indexes `1` and `277` with `353`, starting W40 through W51. Thanks


:footprints: *Steps to reproduce:*
No issue just improvement

elements.text: Hi there team can you please substitute indexes

_thread_replies.text: :importanttt: If your request is related to a *failing test*, please *<https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/TNV/pages/5613486237/Failing+E2E|check this doc first>* for quick troubleshooting/assessment before raising the actual request.

for quick troubleshooting/assessment before raising the actual request.

_thread_replies.text: <@U01AKGWGLC8> can we take care of this quickly so customers have more time to change their selections

elements.text: can we take care of this quickly so customers have more time to change their selections

_thread_replies.text: <!subteam^S08KVQVNV6U> hey firefighters, can someone please do this today?

elements.text: hey firefighters, can someone please do this today?

_thread_replies.text:
synced with himash and i can take this over. was already running this when i saw the message early this morning but it's taking a while to generate the CSVs. i guess it's a lot of replacements.

i'm half way through. will post the results here once they're done :+1:

elements.text:
synced with himash and i can take this over. was already running this when i saw the message early this morning but it's taking a while to generate the CSVs. i guess it's a lot of replacements.

_thread_replies.text: thank you!
thanks Bolo. Can you go through W52 since I created the menu yesterday

elements.text: thanks Bolo. Can you go through W52 since I created the menu yesterday

_thread_replies.text: sure, running the 50 now. will include the 52 as well :+1:

elements.text: sure, running the 50 now. will include the 52 as well

_thread_replies.text: here you go <@U01B2LBUPND>
Thanks much Bolo

hello, following the substitution index 1 and 277 reduced significantly, which is what we intended. However, since these cuts were very popular, reactivations still lead to a relatively high nb of occurences of these index. see attached for W40. These numbers will keep going up over time.

Is there a way for us to explore making these substitutions upstream in customer selections rather than planned boxes?

<@U01AKGWGLC8> <@U0251UW1YUE>

elements.text:
hello, following the substitution index 1 and 277 reduced significantly, which is what we intended. However, since these cuts were very popular, reactivations still lead to a relatively high nb of occurences of these index. see attached for W40. These numbers will keep going up over time.

Is there a way for us to explore making these substitutions upstream in customer selections rather than planned boxes?

_thread_replies.text:
hey Seb! We only run a few lines of commands to run a script of a service called Box-Content-Service to do these substitutions. We don't actually have much knowledge of its architecture to explore new iterations other than what we have currently.

This service is maintained by <#C049H9UE22X|>. I recommend you opening a support request in their channel to check if they could find a way to achieve what you need for reactivations, or if they could add this to their backlog for a future enhancement of the service.

You can open the request in that channel, but here are the main POC for you should you need as well: <https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SHOPFOUND/pages/3977707521/Cart+Foundation+Squad>

elements.text: Owned by: Tales Carlos de Padua | 106 people viewed

_thread_replies.text: hey <@U027201FQSV> sure, but I believe we still need Seb's help in the thread to better expand on what he's missing on the substitutions to fine tune the support request and the motivations behind it, since he works closely with the operations after we generate the CSV from that service

attachments.fallback:
<@U0251UW1YUE>: Hi, I want to report a new cart issue. Please check the details.
*Issue:* `Box-Content-Service for Customer Selections`
*Topic:* `Other`
*Issue Impact:* `High Number of Cuts on Reactivations `
*Description:* `
Hi team, Good Chop squad often use the Box-Content-Service to swap meals (cuts) indexes whenever we have been asked by our operations team, but a question raised recently and since we don't have much knowledge about that service, we need your help as the maintainers.

Is there a way for us to explore making the index substitutions upstream in customer selections rather than planned boxes?

Reason is that last time we did the swap asked and it reduced significantly, which is what we intended. However, since the swap cuts were very popular, reactivations still lead to a relatively high number of occurrences of these indexes. These numbers will keep going up over time.

Could you please help us if there's any way to overcome this situation? Thanks!
 `
*Expected behaviour:* `substitutions upstream in customer selections rather than planned boxes`
*Actual behaviour:* `substitutions only on planned boxes`
*Error log:* ``````

*Category:* squad-cart-foundation
*Command:* cart-foundation-issue
attachments.text:
<@U0251UW1YUE>: Hi, I want to report a new cart issue. Please check the details.
*Issue:* `Box-Content-Service for Customer Selections`
*Topic:* `Other`
*Issue Impact:* `High Number of Cuts on Reactivations `
*Description:* `
Hi team, Good Chop squad often use the Box-Content-Service to swap meals (cuts) indexes whenever we have been asked by our operations team, but a question raised recently and since we don't have much knowledge about that service, we need your help as the maintainers.

Is there a way for us to explore making the index substitutions upstream in customer selections rather than planned boxes?

Reason is that last time we did the swap asked and it reduced significantly, which is what we intended. However, since the swap cuts were very popular, reactivations still lead to a relatively high number of occurrences of these indexes. These numbers will keep going up over time.

Could you please help us if there's any way to overcome this situation? Thanks!
 `
*Expected behaviour:* `substitutions upstream in customer selections rather than planned boxes`
*Actual behaviour:* `substitutions only on planned boxes`
*Error log:* ``````

*Category:* squad-cart-foundation
*Command:* cart-foundation-issue
